koohiiStory1: Since the meaning of "big dipper" is rather specific and the sense of measurement seems to be a more common usage, I concentrate on the primative meaning of measuring cup. This is a pictograph, with the first two strokes representing the measuring ticks on the side of the cup.
koohiiStory2: Is it just me, or do all of these traditional kanji pictographs look like they were drawn by a retarded bunny rabbit?
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The ladle radical and the ladle kanji are the same!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You use a ladle to distribute soup. But as you're ladling you find something odd floating in the soup. It's... a toe (ã¨)! You scream, dropping the ladle and the toe on the ground.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Your mom comes rushing in and smacks you on the head. "Fool!" she says, "This is toe soup, what did you think you'd ladle up?!" Oops.

humanum_full_description_en:
A long-handled spoon used by a golden inscription elephant to scoop water. Li Xiaoding explained: "Qiwen Bronze inscriptions are just like a fight with a handle. Ancient Shengdou are like this. In the text, there is no difference, but there is no difference between the points: the one with no point is the fighting character... the one with the point is the promotion." See " rise ".

Oracle is used as the star name, "Poetry. Xiaoya. "Dadong": "Weibei has a bucket, so you can't mix wine pulp." Gai " dou " is a group of stars in the north of Xuanwu Qisu in the middle of the 28th place, and the nearest western group of stars. The main stars are named Tianshu, Tianxuan, Tianji, Tianquan, Yuheng, Kaiyang and Yaoguang from Doukui to Piao. Since it is a celestial phenomenon, Xu Shen specifically said that "you can't mix wine syrup"! Bronze inscriptions are used as a unit of capacity, Qin Gonggui: "One bucket and seven liters."

"Shuowen": "Fighting, ten liters. Pictograms, with handles. All those who fight are from fighting."
humanum_short_description_en: Inscriptions like a long-handled spoon for scooping water.

Heisig: The Big Dipper here is of course the constellation of Ursa Major, of which this kanji is a sort of pictographic representation.

    Fight
    Basic explanation of words
    Fight
    dÇ’u
    China's municipal capacity unit (ten liters is a bucket, ten buckets is a stone): a chicken with wine (often used as a simple food and drink for entertaining guests, and a common meal).
    Apparatus for measuring food: the person of the bucket (describes a person with a small amount of equipment and short-sightedness).
    Describe the bigness of small things: bold.
    Small to describe big things: small rooms.
    Something like a bucket: a bucket truck. Hat. cloak. Iron.
    The star name, one of the twenty-eight constellations, also refers to the star: Nandou. Angrily bullfight (furious).
    Especially refers to the "Big Dipper": Fighting to zhe snake.
    Gu Tong is "steep" and towering.
    [Dougong] (æ“æ ±) Arch is an arc-shaped load-bearing structure on the building, and the bucket is a square wooden block that cushions the arch, collectively known as the bucket.
    Gu Tong "steep" suddenly.
    Fight
    (Bucket)
    dÃ²u
    Sparring: fighting. fighting.
    Victory in the competition: fighting strength. Fighting. battle of wits. High morale.
    Make animals compete with each other: bullfighting. Cricket fighting.
    Piece together, align, move closer: cross-eyed.
    Gu Tong "joy", tease lead.
    Fight
    Chinese dictionary definition of words
    [â‘ ]ï¼»dÇ’uï¼½
    ["Guangyun" is cut at the mouth, thick, and end. ]
    Also called "î–š1".
    (1) The name of the ancient wine vessel.
    (2) Measuring device. The capacity is one bucket.
    (3) That is Douzi. An officer in charge of the Cang Cang.
    (4) Quantifiers. Used to measure wine.
    (5) Quantifiers. Used to measure food. Refers to the capacity of ten liters.
    (6) Quantifiers. A unit used to calculate bow force in ancient times.
    (7) It is a metaphor for small things. See "small room".
    (8) It is a metaphor for the greatness of things. See "Courageous".
    (9) Bucket-shaped utensils.
    (10) Refers to Diao Dou. Military equipment in ancient times.
    (11) The square wooden block used in construction is placed between the arch and the arch.
    (12) The protruding part of the image of the carved figure on the tomb of the Han Dynasty, the upper part is big and the lower part is small, and its shape is like a bucket, so it is called.
    (13) Abbreviation for bucket fingerprint. It is composed of many loops and spirals.
    (14) The name of the stars. It is named because it is like a bucket. Refers to the Big Dipper.
    (15) The name of the constellation. It is named because it is like a bucket. Refers to one of the twenty-eight places, the first place of the seven places in the north of Xuanwu, also known as Nandou, with six stars.
    (16) The name of the stars. It is named because it is like a bucket. Refers to the five stars of Tianshiyuan Xiaodou.
    (17) The name of the stars. It is named because it is like a bucket. Also refers to the stars.
    (18) Refers to Doumu, the goddess in ancient mythology. Later believed in Taoism and regarded as the mother of the Big Dipper.
    (19) Through "steep".
